text: I suppose one way to do it would be to put the data up on github gist or something and `Read.CSV` and provide a URL or some sort.

elements.text: I suppose one way to do it would be to put the data up on github gist or something and
Read.CSV
and provide a URL or some sort.

text: yes, I think the simplest way to do it would be to just post a raw CSV somewhere, unless you have unusual data types.  You can read it in from a text file, or even directly from source code by putting it in a string `str` and using `CSV.File(IOBuffer(str))`

elements.text: yes, I think the simplest way to do it would be to just post a raw CSV somewhere, unless you have unusual data types.  You can read it in from a text file, or even directly from source code by putting it in a string
str
